title: Pilot Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very chill process. For students only and have a couple different rounds of interviewing but it is very chill. Would reccomend to everyone to apply. Good interview process
Interview Questions: What are your strengths / weaknesses

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy and understandably so as they want to ensure the right person is selected. There were about 5 interviews in total 2 of which were in-person
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral interview questions; be prepared to provide examples of your work and how you would handle certain situations.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: After being scheduled for an interview, I did attend it and it lasted for an hour. My experience was average. But what I can not understand and cannot stand is the ghosting after that. I must have sent two follow up emails but nobody ever answered. I understand people being busy but it takes respect and consideration to simply respond and give an update ( positive or negative). But just give an update and treat people with respect!
Interview Questions: Run us through your resume

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time but very friendly staff! Lots of red tape to cross so it’s good to keep an open mind while interviewing. Would recommend as a place to work for sure!
Interview Questions: What was my interest in and Commitment to DEIA?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with HR recruiter. Once I passed that I met with a member of the team and the VP of Admissions. It.was standard procedure. Leave early. Navigating.the university can be difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with an irate individual.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. I gave a job talk. Interview questions are in line with my interests and interviewers were well informed and prepared. Overall I think it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to be in your career in 10 years?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 2 part application with a group interview as the second part, along with diverse individuals from all around the world I learnt a lot and gratefully got in the university.
Interview Questions: Reasons for applying to the program as well as the university.

title: IT Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: 3 step process , that included phone screening, video interview and assessment. 3 step process , that included phone screening, video interview and assessment. 3 step process , that included phone screening, video interview and assessment.
Interview Questions: What certifications do you currently hold?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Columbia, MD) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions:
DataBase:

How to enhance database performance ?

Asp.net mvc

Filters in asp.net

How to enhance database performance ?

Asp.net mvc
Oop questions 
Filters in asp.net
How request got dispatched to controllers?

they wasn’t fair on their feedback.

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It's a panel interview. There are 4 people; hiring manager, 2 senior biostatisticians and one project coordinator. The interview is relatively easy on average and asked me about the projects that I'm working on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Tell me about experience using a statistical software. Did you learn the concepts of statistics? Tell me about the project that you enjoyed the most. How did you handle when you face a challenging situation in data analysis?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions:
The process took over a month involving a panel presentation, just to be ghosted without even receiving a rejection.

My experience left me quite perplexed due to the reputation that Johns Hopkins University/Medicine holds. I had two interviews. The second interview required a presentation on a project that was based on a prompt we were given. All the feedback I received was positive. I was told I'd hear back the following week. At this point it's been almost 3 weeks since the last interview and despite sending 2 emails to the Director that I interviewed with on both occasions and 1 email to the project manager out of concern, there was no response or communication. It baffles me how such a prestigious school and organization can be so blatantly unprofessional. It takes little time to send a rejection email and really comes down to common courtesy. Maybe that's just how corporations are doing business these days, but I have to say I didn't expect this from JHU and am quite disappointed. I think I speak for many when I say that, we'd rather receive a rejection than be ghosted.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself as a designer?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Thorough but took a long time to set up. Seems like they are more interested in educational background than experience, but understandable since they are a higher education place, and place a higher value on education.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work there

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the same generic questions that does not allow the employer to know you as a person. Overall, it was not intimidating and if you can pick three words to describe yourself that sets the tone for the rest of the interview.
Interview Questions: What type of management style do I prefer?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I had a phone interview with the employer and I was selected for the next round. The interview was conducted remotely. I have to give 30 min power point presentation. Overall, the interview process was smooth and well-planned.
Interview Questions: Background of my previous work

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Online application - straightforward Email from HR Three rounds of interviews 3 weeks waiting Offer in low end of salary Limited access to hiring manager Nice HR Great benefits, especially tuition
Interview Questions: A time you overcame an obstacle?

title: Office of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in person. I could tell the team was not in communication with each other. They seem really disorganized. But they where really friendly and they seem to get along pretty well.
Interview Questions: Asked about my hobbies? and about work history

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very detailed, direct, interview process. Strong emphasis on skill level and relevant experience. It took 3 rounds of interviews that lasted about 30 minutes each. Individual interviews with current team members and direct reports
Interview Questions: How do past skills you have gained improve your value to the team?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: There were two parts. The first part was a brief phone interview and the second was a panel via zoom. Notes were taken during both parts. At the end they asked if you had any questions.
Interview Questions: A time that I got negative feedback and how I dealt with it.

title: Post Baccalaureate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Application with personal statement, 30 minute interview with guided tour of facilities. Interviewer asked if I had any questions first, asked me what I thought was important in a school before asking me qs.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a post-bacc program?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was first. Then I was interviewed in person by three individuals separately. The first person was the hiring manager. Next, was the director of the department. Finally, I was interveiwed by a would be co-worker.
Interview Questions: What did I know about the university, and specifically, the department.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward. Hiring manager was easy to talk to and very conversational. Mostly just reviewing the job description and questions about how your prior experience can be applied to the position.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working independently with little supervision?

title: Video Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: 3 separate zoom interviews, two panels, and one one on one. They Offered me job within about 1 day after interviews and overall I would say the interview process at large was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Pretty basic questions, repeated throughout interview process.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Friendly. questions related to the position. Explained everything and was easy to follow. Detail. Moved to the next interview and also, they were friendly, communicative. It was like chatting with a co-worker
Interview Questions: How would you describe a partnership?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was 30 minutes long via zoom with pretty general interview questions, then second round was a 3 hour on campus interview with campus partners and then the office staff with more behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a colleague you are in conflict with?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Quick process in the beginning, with a basic, initial 30-minute interview. This was followed by a panel interview that I created a presentation for two weeks later. However after that second/final interview, I heard nothing. I reached out after over two weeks for them to tell me to keep waiting. Over a month later, I received a no-reply automated rejection notice for the position. I felt frustrated since this type of rejection was cold and did not allow me to reach out for feedback. Overall, a big waste of my time and effort.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position, tell me about relevant experience you have to this role

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: quite lengthy or average to the role interview second round get offer letter accept and/or decline I am pleased with the overall process, however I wish it would have been shorter and gotten a sooner response from HR team
Interview Questions: specific to the role and occupation

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Three four rounds of interview screening, in person technical and meet and greet/ round table interview with team. Three four rounds of interview screening, in person technical and meet and greet/ round table interview with team.
Interview Questions: Technical and project management question

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Wasnt too bad. They ask about what you are doing on campus and how your current and past classes can relate to what you will do on the job and future jobs.
Interview Questions: What classes are you taking?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview process.  Involves first phone call with HR, another video interview with your potential manager/director, then more high ups interviews and a case study.  A bit too extensive for a position like this...
Interview Questions: Why us, background, tell me about a time...etc.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took several weeks, incredibly in depth that included 3 interviews. It was a difficult process but understandably so with the schools reputation. Interviewer didn't email back about the outcome until prompted and then ghosted after saying I did not get the job
Interview Questions: What level of experience do you have with graphic design?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fair. Questions related to the economy (course related), recent news (list several important news), and related job/internship experience (especially teaching related). Also introduced hobbies and plans for my future career.
Interview Questions: What is the most impressive economic news you have seen recently?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: phone screening, then two rounds of interviews. the first round is with several members in the team, and it's mostly behavioral. The second round is with 9 team members, and a few stats questions were asked.
Interview Questions: what's the diff between std and standard error?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: First, I was asked to send a sample data analysis code for review. Next, I was then called an interview via zoom. After a week I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Straight forward and casual questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the PI based on an email circulated to my department as a student. They interviewed me, spoke with my references then set things up with HR. The job posting online was a formality.
Interview Questions: Primarily about who I was, program I was in, and concept questions about the project.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult, is a good place to work and HR is very nice. Go big for go home my homie! I repaired the chair during the interview and got an offer immediately.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest strength and weakness?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Meeting date and time was scheduled via email. The manager was very nice, friendly and welcoming. She talked about the Lab in general and about the job duties and what to expect. We had a casual conversation
Interview Questions: Why do you think we should hire you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: I gave a research presentation in the lab meeting and then talked to every lab member to understand their projects.  After the official interview, I also had dinner with them.
Interview Questions: What is your research and career plan?

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Three - part interview process; met with several levels of leadership in a group interview style each time.  First contact was a phone call, second and third contacts were video conferences.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us something that isn’t on your resume?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions:
It was kind and friendly and interview time was also 15min - 20min which was not too short or not too long. 
I like that the result came out fast.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews one with support staff and one with the department lead. Both were held via zoom the first interview was approximately 30 mins and the second was 1 hour.
Interview Questions:
What is your strength?
Discuss how you previously diffused a confrontation at your current position. 
Tell me a time you made a mistake and how did you resolve that mistake. 
Why are you the right person for this position?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Two comprehensive interviews: the first included a number of behavioral questions about specific work experiences/challenges and how you managed them; the second was more specific to the direct responsibilities of the role and how your experiences prepared you to succeed
Interview Questions:
What are some examples of your supervisory experience?

What is your specific experience supervising employees in an online environment?

title: Senior Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward for a semi-internal hire, which allowed for bypassing of the typical interview process. Interviews with research teams is separate from HR processes. HR is inefficient and processes are very convoluted, which can make interviewing and onboarding difficult or confusing for external candidates.
Interview Questions: Had a modified process as an internal hire

title: Technical Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: There was a lack of communication before, and during the interview process and I ultimately withdrew my application.  In speaking with the recruiter for this position, the salary was not at all commensurate with the job duties for the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Was super quick and then they turned on me. Offered me the job then took the offer back.  I am still not sure what happened but it was very unprofessional
Interview Questions: Very typical of a development interview

title: Regulatory Affairs Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick and hiring manager was very nice. All the interviewer were very nice, calm and friendly. Interview  process was very smooth and fast. Overall it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Strength, prioritizing the task, and weakness.

title: Mechanical Engineering PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Hour conversation about my research experience, with a deep time into the details of one of my projects, along with a sprinkling of the lab's research goals and what I'd potentially be doing there.
Interview Questions: What are your PhD goals?

title: Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 6 different team members in three different zoom calls. Everyone was very nice and polite and said great things about the work environment and culture. Since this is a position that many people are only in for 2-6 years before moving on to graduate school the environment is conducive to that.
Interview Questions: Do you have clinical research experience working directly with treatment seeking participants?

title: Pilot Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: they asked a few questions about chemistry & they ask about sharing something unique. they want to see that you are personable but also know what you are doing. if you have good interpersonal skills and you studied for the class you should be good to do. do some preparation for the interview. they don’t ask anything super crazy but it still helps to have a good idea.
Interview Questions: Teach something in two minutes

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked about my experience.  It is important to distinguish research done as a part of study Vs research done under a PI / professor.  It is important to be patient with interviewer. Each university has criteria for what is and isn't an acceptable format of research
Interview Questions: What kind of research did you perform

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The First interview was with the hiring manager, second interviews with Chair and Director.  It was a Quick process, all staff were very professional.  It was a positive experience overall, transparency is key.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your Experience

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant, wasn't very pushy showed me around and told me more about the position, very nice experience. The place I interviewed at was hard to find but I eventually found my way.
Interview Questions:
Why work here 
tell me about yourself

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a virtual one-on-one interview with the hiring manager. The second was a group virtual interview. The third and final interview was an in-person, four-hour event—an on-campus tour, a meal and a presentation of a sample marketing campaign. Everyone seemed friendly and interested in having me on the team. I prepped my pitch for days, completely rearranged my schedule to make myself available for half a workday and didn't learn until five weeks later (through an automated, completely impersonal notification) that I wasn't getting the job. I followed up with the hiring manager multiple times asking for an update and then ultimately whether there were any weak points I could have improved. He couldn't be bothered to reply. It was incredibly unprofessional and disrepectful.
Interview Questions: How would diversity, equity and inclusion factor in to my marketing strategy?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers provided a lot of helpful information and asked thoughtful questions. No curveballs and were genuinely interested in my background. It felt conversational and made me excited to be part of the team.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role? Will it work with your full-time job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Seeking local researchers. We are looking for local researchers who can aid us through conducting interviews and translating information into English. We would love to recruit someone with a background in mental heatlh
Interview Questions: Please contact for further information. We have a list of working questions that specifically relate to the research objectives and goals

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: It was less of an interview and more of a re-hashing of your resume. It was not very intimidating but you will know by the end of the interview whether or not you've gotten the position
Interview Questions: Are you proficient in Microsoft Office

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Not so long and very open! Happened during Covid so everything was virtually done. Love the experience. Interview was done in 3 different parts as well. Every supervisor was friendly. They broke down the job duties very much so too.
Interview Questions: About your previous work experience

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone screening, then an in person interview with the department manager. I met the team I would be working with at the interview and heard that I got the job a few days later. Onboarding took almost 2 months.
Interview Questions: Do my skills match the job position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. Very easy and convenient, I really enjoyed talking about the job and responsibilities more than anything else. The interviewer was genuinely interested in my background and experiences.
Interview Questions:
Can you tell me about yourself? 
Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard process but overall it was slow and at times frustrating. My HR contact was non-responsive and, when reached, could not answer some of my most basic questions. Had great interviews with direct manager and future colleagues.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about your data analysis skills
Why do you want this position?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Not too difficult, basic questions about undergrad research and publications. Be sure to check with professors beforehand for vacancies as a successful acceptance is slightly dependent on whether the professor you chose has a vacancy or not.
Interview Questions:
Explain about the undergraduate research?
What are your interests in grad school?
Some technical questions about undergrad research publication.

title: Graphic Design Summer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was friendly and nice. Talked about what the job consists of and what are my strengths. Did not get the job at the end. The job is paid and it is remote.
Interview Questions: What programs I am familiar with

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Went through 2 phone interviews then had a zoom call with the whole team and they all took turns and asked questions.  Then I had to present on backward design.
Interview Questions: What is your design process?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill. Basic questions and nothing complex. Definitely read my resume and wanted to be accommodating with me and my existent schedule. Asked relevant questions and typical questions in an interview
Interview Questions: What would you say is your Biggest strength

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked for a zoom meeting 1 month after I applied followed by an offline interview. Interviewers are friendly. Interview is easy as long as you have theoretical knowledge of what you have learned.
Interview Questions:
1. How will you cope with learning new things that you have no prior experience of?
2. Basic interview questions like tell me about yourself, what are your strengths and weaknesses and what are your future long term goals

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Interview went fine, though from the get go, it seemed that they had already gone with another hire.  They were heavily interested in diversity and seemed to tell me as much during the process.  This is a difficult spot to be in when you do not bring the right demographic they are looking for.  Please don't bring in candidates to interview if you already know you will go with a minority hire!
Interview Questions: What classes could you teach for us?

title: Salesforce Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first was the "Technical Interview Screening" and a couple weeks later was the  second interview. The second interview involved a formal Technical Interview followed by Company Fit interview / review of Technical Interview
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for employment elsewhere?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted directly by hiring manager for the interview, was on Zoom, didn’t feel very formal. She asked very basic questions about my background and a few behavioral questions. Interview was set for 30 minutes, but it went by really quick! 
They’re fast at responding
Interview Questions: Can you give an example of a moment where you disagreed with a team member on an approach?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume for review and was invited for a phone screen. Basic questions regarding background were asked and was invited for a second interview with the hiring manager. No follow-up contact of any sort was received after the second interview from either of the interviewing parties.
Interview Questions: What is the reason for wanting to leave your current role?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Great!  Was given some questions in advance. The contact was very quick and friendly.  I was impressed with the information given in advance!  I was sent an email several weeks in advance with an assignment to remit prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: I had to correct some wording in a statement, which was not difficult.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Professional and friendly staff. Interview was very easy going and the manager was very pleasant. Asked a lot about what I expect to see from the company and why I would make a good fit there.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a good job environment

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds. First it behavioral. Second is technical. They will ask why you want the position, how your experience aligns with the job at hand, do you see a long term career with them, and whether you're willing to work on new skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position? Do you have a passion for public health?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Casual if you know the professor. Be aware of projects and publications in process. Technical skills are very helpful. Know the ins and outs of the lab you're applying to.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that are pertinent to this position?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: Two-stage interview. In the beginning there’s a phone screening with pretty basic questions about your background experience, what challenges you for see, and any questions you have. Second interview is in-person (normally). You do a 5-minute presentation on a topic of your choice (stick to 5 minutes and really any topic you want) followed by two sets of interviews with the hiring team and management. Felt very organized and I wasn’t totally thrown off guard by the questions.
Interview Questions: What challenges do you anticipate in this role? Also ask about how you would handle the selectivity of the admissions process.

title: Contracts Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the head of the department to schedule a Zoom interview. The interview was about 30-40 minutes on Zoom. Then I was asked to do a group interview with other people in that department. Then I had to talk to some other people.
Interview Questions:
Basic questions in regard to my resume.
Asked how I would handle certain situations that may occur on the job.

title: Course Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by the hiring manager, no screening or contact with HR was involved. The communication was very professional and organized, with each step clearly laid out.  For the first interview, I was asked to prepare a 10-minute presentation based on a given prompt. The interview was scheduled about two weeks in advance, so I had plenty of time to prepare.  In addition, I was asked to provide some work samples prior to the interview. The interview was on Zoom with the hiring manager as well as two team members, who all took turns asking questions. The second and final Zoom interview came the following week, this time with the hiring manager and the director. Although I was not chosen for the role, the manager was very gracious in sending me a personalized message.
Interview Questions: What is your proudest professional accomplishment?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Online zoom interview Just ask me a few questions like why this program Your future career goal and etc normal questions
Easy interview like 15 minutes and got results in 2 days
Interview Questions: Why you want to choose this program

title: Communications Specialist Interview
